data.title: Actors Who Died on August 9
data.meta_description: Famous deaths in film and TV for the 9th of August. Browse actors, actresses and directors that died on August 9.
data.text:
Harry Davenport, American actor and director (Her Unborn Child, My Sin), dies at 83

Creighton Hale, Irish actor (Gorilla Man, Way Down East), dies at 76

Anton Walbrook [Adolf Wohlbrook], Austrian actor (Laura, I Accuse), dies of a heart attack at 66

1967 Joe Orton, British actor and dramatist (Prick Up Your Ears), is murdered by his partner Kenneth Halliwell at 34

Robert Lehman, American banker (Lehrman Brothers) and arts benefactor (Robert Lehman Wing at the Met Museum of Art), dies at 77

Sharon Tate

American actress (Valley of the Dolls), murdered by Manson's gang at 26

Edward Chapman, British actor (Things to Come, Promoter, Rembrandt), dies at 75

Allan Frank, American actor (Charade Quiz), dies at 64

Elliott Nugent, American director and actor, dies at 83

Alexandre Alexeieff, Russian-French filmmaker (pinscreen animation) and artist, dies at 81

Dorothy Appleby, American actress (Small Town Boy, Paradise Express), dies at 84

John Schofield, English BBC journalist, shot to death in Croatia at 29

Nicholas Markowitz, American teenager kidnapped and murdered by Jesse James Hollywood at 15

Gregory Hines, American actor and dancer (White Nights; Taps), dies of liver cancer at 57

2003 Jacques Deray, French film director (b. 1929)

David Raksin, American composer renown for his work in film and TV (Laura; Modern Times), dies at 92

Matthew McGrory, American actor (worlds's tallest actor at 7 ft 6 in), dies at 32

Bernie Mac, American comedian and actor (The Bernie Mac Show, Ocean's Eleven), dies of cardiac arrest at 50

Frank Gifford, American College-Pro Football HOF halfback (USC; 6 × First-team All-Pro, 8 × Pro Bowl; NY Giants) and broadcaster (ABC Monday Night Football), dies at 84

Alex Cord [Alexander Viespi], American actor (Brotherhood; Fire; Street Asylum; Airwolf), dies at 88

2021 Bob Jenkins, American television and radio sports announcer (IndyCar & NASCAR telecasts ESPN/ABC, NBC Sports), dies from brain cancer at 73

2021 Patricia Hitchcock, British-American actress (Strangers on a Train), dies at 93

(Jaime Royal) "Robbie" Robertson, Canadian-Mohawk singer-songwriter and rock guitarist (The Band - "The Weight"; "Up On Cripple Creek"), and soundtrack composer (Martin Scorsese films), dies of prostate cancer at 80 [1] [2]

2023 Ita Ever, Estonian stage, radio, and screen actress (Tayna chyornykh drozdov (The Secret of the Blackbirds)), dies at 92

Susan Wojcicki

American businesswoman (CEO of YouTube, 2014-23; Google executive, 1999-2014), considered "the most important person in advertising", dies of lung cancer at 56
